Adult male.description: Males have a white patch in the wing unlike male Black Scoters. They also lack the yellow knob on the bill.

Female.description: Females have whitish spots on the face and don't have the dark-capped look of female Black Scoters. They also have a white patch in the wings that Black Scoters lack, although it can be hard to see.

Adult male.description: Male Surf Scoters have a white patch on the back of the neck that male Black Scoters lack. The bill is orange, white, and black (not yellow).

Female.description: Females have a vertical patch on the sides of the face while female Black Scoters have a uniformly pale cheek. Surf Scoters have a more sloping bill than Black Scoters.

Adult.description: American Coots are smaller with a thinner bill than Black Scoters. Their bill is white, whereas male Black Scoters have a yellow knob on their bill and females have a brown bill.
